subsubsection.title: Vocabulary
subsubsection.p:
Look up the definitions of new terms in the Glossary.
Compound inequality
Interval notation

li.p: We can use a graphical technique to solve quadratic inequalities.
If ax^2 + bx \gt c for a particular value of x, what can you say about the graph of y = ax^2 + bx - c at that x-value?
What are the only x-values at which the graph of y = ax^2 + bx + c can change sign?
Explain the difference between an open interval and a closed interval.
Explain what is wrong with the following "solution" to a quadratic inequality: 2\gt x\gt 8.
The parabola y = x^2 + bx + c has x-intercepts at r_1 and r_2, with r_1\lt r_2. What are the solutions of the inequality x^2 + bx + c \gt 0?
The parabola y = x^2 + bx + c has x-intercepts at r_1 and r_2, with r_1\lt r_2. What are the solutions of the inequality x^2 + bx + c \le 0?
The parabola y = -x^2 + bx + c has x-intercepts at r_1 and r_2, with r_1\lt r_2. What are the solutions of the inequality -x^2 + bx + c \le 0?
The parabola y = -x^2 + bx + c has x-intercepts at r_1 and r_2, with r_1\lt r_2. What are the solutions of the inequality -x^2 + bx + c \gt 0?
